Name: Le Chic Resto Pop
Brief description: The organization offers, through its socially responsible restaurant, nutritious, quality meals at low prices to meet the needs of people experiencing food insecurity. It is also a welcoming living environment, open to all, which promotes social diversity

Name: Maison de Quartier Villeray
Brief description: La Maison de Quartier Villeray is a registered charity that has been established since 1989. It offers activities promoting the creation of bonds of mutual aid and solidarity between participants, with the aim of individual and collective empowerment. , which contributes to improving the living conditions of citizens.

Name: Resto Plateau
Brief description: A player in the social economy, Resto Plateau is a non-profit organization whose mission is to promote autonomy, inclusion and access to resources to meet essential needs such as food security, of the Montreal community and the surrounding area.

Name: MADA Community Center
Brief description: volunteer-based organization that evolved from a small neighbourhood centre to Montreal’s central address for fighting poverty in our community

Name: Mile End Mission
Brief description: Mile End Community Mission is a volunteer-run, not-for-profit organization and community centre working with members of the community who have been marginalized by society for a variety of reasons.  Our services are used by people of all ages, many of whom struggle with addiction, are in poverty and/or are homeless.

Name: Sun Youth Organization
Brief description: We have been taking care of people for more than 65 years by providing individuals and families in need, a wide range of emergency services that ensure their basic needs are covered and maintain their integrity.

Name: Cuisine et Vie Collective St Roch
Brief description: We are a non-profit organization whose objective is to enable a better quality of life and support for individuals and families in the Parc-Extension district by developing a strong support network around various initiatives. aimed at food security and autonomy: collective kitchens, workshops, courses, distribution of food, training and social activities

Name: Partageons L'espoir
Available roles: prep, delivery, sort, grocery store, thrift store
Brief description: Inspired by the vision of a vibrant community where everyone has the opportunity and the means to achieve their dreams, Share the Warmth's mission is to sow hope and dream in the community through quality programs aimed at the development and success of young people, access to healthy food and health for all and training and preparation for employment.

Name: West Island Mission
Available roles: sort, warehouse, delivery, pick up, garden, harvest
Brief description: West Island Mission is a non-profit organization that provides well-balanced, high quality food assistance and other related aid to the less fortunate living in the West Island of Montreal. We offer three programs: monthly food assistance, Christmas food baskets and back-to-school support.

Name: Centre de Ressource et D'action Communautaire Petite Patrie
Brief description: The La Petite-Patrie Community Resource and Action Center (CRACPP) is an organization that fights against poverty. Through its food security activities and its fight against waste, it contributes to improving the living conditions of members of its community and to the defense of fundamental human rights.

Name: Le PAS de la Rue
Brief description: Le PAS de la rue is a non-profit that, for more than twenty years, helps, accompanies and supports people 55 and older who are homeless, in severe economic precariousness or in social isolation.
